Exaggerate: The claim suggests that allowing all Bush income tax cuts to expire will result in the largest tax increase in the history of America. This could be seen as an exaggeration since it does not provide sufficient evidence or comparison to other tax increases in history.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that allowing the tax cuts to expire will result in the largest tax increase, without considering other factors or alternative explanations.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide enough evidence or support to substantiate the assertion that it will be the largest tax increase in history.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or potential consequences of allowing the tax cuts to expire, such as potential economic benefits or the impact on different income groups.
